author: palmbeachpost
title: Looking Ahead: Halloween fall fest, craft fest, blues on...
text:
DELRAY BEACH
Pioneers return
Chris Matula You never know what you’ll find at the Downtown Stuart Craft Festival. Six ghosts from Delray Beach’s past will return, for one night, on Friday, Oct. 16, from 6 to 9 p.m. for the Delray Beach Historical Society’s Halloween Fall Festival. These pioneers will haunt the historic Cason Cottage Museum. The guests — or “ghosts” — will be Esther Sterling Williams; educator Solomon D. Spady; Delray’s first mayor, John Sundy; architect Sam Ogren; farmer Adolf Hoffman; and Native American Billy Bowlegs. The event also features a haunted house, two outdoor Halloween-themed movies at dusk, and activities for the family. Free. 5 NE First St. 561-274-9578; www.delraybeachhistory.org
STUART
Craft fest
Billy Bowlegs, shown here in the mid-1850s, will return on Oct. 16 to the Delray Beach Historical Society. On Saturday and Sunday, Oct. 17-18, the Downtown Stuart Craft Festival will be held from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. More than 100 crafters will exhibit and sell their works, including photography, paintings, sculpture, jewelry and more. Free admission. Osceola Street. artfestival.com
ROYAL PALM BEACH
Fresh veggies in new location
The Royal Palm Beach Green Market and Bazaar will return Sunday, Oct. 18, for its third season, at its new location, in Veterans Park. Hours are 9 a.m. to 1 p.m.; the season runs through April 24. Shop for locally grown plants and organic products, from fruits and vegetables to favorites like homemade salsa and baked goods. Free. 1036 Royal Palm Beach Blvd. 561-792-9260; www.rpbgreenmarket.com
WEST PALM BEACH
Hear the blues
The City of West Palm Beach Department of Recreation will present the Markey Blue Band on Oct. 18 during Sunday on the Waterfront. The blues band, which plays from 4 to 7 p.m. at the Meyer Amphitheatre, weaves elements of soul with rhythm-and-blues pop songwriting and fire-breathing arrangements. Free. wpb.org/events
</span
